channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Inappropriate images on the display in the windows on the gallery, 8th August
item.description:
Miłość gallery Is currently has highly provocative art exhibition and its exposed to anyone passing by. Not against the art but male genitalia that is two meters in size should be closed from passers by that include minors. Primary school is opposite

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Downham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown bushes, 8th August
item.description:
Bushes are all over grown on to the walking paths on both sides. They need to be trimmed back.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Crescent Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: Dog Fouling, 8th August
item.description:
There is a huge volume of dog fouling in Bromley around Haywwod Road. On almost every street I walk on around this area (Jaffray road, Southland Road, Homesdale Road, Havelock Road) I will come across dog faeces. What can be done to enforce responsible dog ownership?! It is really disgusting!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haywood Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car has not moved for 4 weeks, 8th August
item.description:
Car has a flat tyre and looks abandoned as it has not moved for sometime. Its taking up parking spaces that homeowners cannot use in Greenway

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Greenway, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree falling fruit and leaves hazardous., 8th August
item.description:
2 cherry trees outside no 41 and 45 Haywood Road. Both trees require pruning (despite the 1 outside 41 being pruned a fee weeks ago after logging request as too close to property). The fruit falling from leaves are dangerous: It makes the footpath slippy and I cannot enter my house without fallen cherry fruit being brought inside on shoes. It attracts huge volume wasps and flies which makes entering and exiting my property very hazardous. I have 2 small children and a new baby - the wasps are dangerous to have right outside our house. Residents are avoiding parking under the trees as the cars are destroyed with cherry fruit and bird faeces. This is hazardous again as the car attracts wasps(v difficult getting children in and out of car) and is harmful to the cars requiring more cost in more frequent car washing required. It is a health and safety issue with my children and not being able to enter or exit the house with the excessive mess on the path and the wasps and flies it attracts. It means I cannot park outside of my house either. These trees have never been maintained properly by the council, perhaps path cleaning happens once per year but given that cherry trees shed their blossom then fruit then leaves , this is not near enough. I would like to request that the trees are removed. It is an extremely poor choice of tree for a residential street. There is a high risk of harm to my children (or anyone but particularly children) due to the slippy footpath and the constant amount of wasps and flies. The limited street parking is even more restricted now. It is a yearly issue and this year it is particularly bad with the trees not being pruned properly and the amount of wasps. I would like the trees removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haywood Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped bed posts, 8th August
item.description:
Dumped bed posts and slates from 45 Rancliffe Gardens, been dumped in walk way from Rancliffe to kingsholm. Remaining posts still in the front garden of 45 Rancliffe gardens, will soon be dumped too

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rancliffe Gardens, Well Hall, London

item.title: Pieces of Glass Ignored by Street Cleaner for DAYS, 8th August
item.description:
A bottle or something made of glass smashed and left shards of glass around the chicane. It's been there all week. Dog walkers, kids, walking through a pile of glass that over time has just spread through footfall.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sanford Walk, Hackney, London

item.title: I was walking home and a dog jumped to bite me, 8th August
item.description:
I was walking on the street from the shop and a dog, he seemed to be a wolf type, jumped at me and bite me I struggled around 1 minute or so to pull my t shirt of he's mouth and after I was able to do it he was still trying to jump at me and bite me

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Picardy Street, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street and pavement cleaning, 8th August
item.description:
W used to have regular pavement and street cleaning along Orchard Road and lower sundridge Park road, it isn't happening. Mini cabs park up in Sundridge park avenue close to Copley dene and just throw wrappers and dosguarded food out of cats, there are broken bottles and disguarded gas cannisters as well as lots of twigs, leaves and vegitation. t almost like the middle of autum rather than summer, it smells, please clean it up
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sundridge Avenue, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The tree overfrowth is still blocking the vision of the crossing, 8th August
item.description:
This issue is not resolevd it has been reported 3 times and closed down twice. This happens everyyear the tree surgeons who came out last year said it should be dealt with every 3 months during the growth season, this year we have tried to get you out and reported it as H&S which is obvious, but nothing happens. can you get it dealy with please

item.description:

item.title: Overhanging tree foilage at junction of Elm Way/Poplar Grove, 8th August
item.description:
An overgrown tree at junction of Elm Way (house no 1) and poplar grove is a danger and hazard for pedestrians. Branches and foliage are very overgrown and hangs low, hitting heads, and the fruit is dropping to then ground and causing slips, trips and falls to disabled pedestrians. Also obstructs the road name sign.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73, Poplar Grove, Colney Hatch, London
Report on FixMyStreet
